name: AugurkCSharpAnalyzer
description: Performs a static code analysis over your test automation and uploads the results to Augurk
author: Jonathan Mezach, Mark Taling

inputs.name: solution
inputs.label: Solution(s)
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to the solution file that should be analyzed

inputs.name: specificationProject
inputs.label: Specification project
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the project containing the feature files

inputs.name: connectedServiceName
inputs.label: Augurk Instance
inputs.helpMarkDown: Augurk instance to which the results should be uploaded.

inputs.name: productName
inputs.label: Product Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the product under which the features have been published to Augurk.

inputs.name: version
inputs.label: Version
inputs.helpMarkDown: Version of the feature files that have been uploaded to Augurk. Supports variables (in the format $(<variable-name>).

inputs.name: toolLocation
inputs.label: Augurk.CSharpAnalyzer.exe Location
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to where the command line Augurk.CSharpAnalyzer.exe tool is located. This is usually installed through the Augurk.CSharpAnalyzer NuGet package. If this package is installed the default will suffice, otherwise another path must be specified.

inputs.name: additionalArguments
inputs.label: Additional argument(s)
inputs.helpMarkDown: Any additional command line arguments you want to pass to Augurk.CSharpAnalyzer.exe
